ComputerStudent1, it can be. Take a look at the apples and oranges here to give you a sense of what it means to read a compare and contrast. In this text structure, we are looking to find what the writer thinks are similarities and differences between two or more things.
OK. So, here an apple and an orange are both fruit, but one is red and the other is orange?
That's a good comparison! Here is another way of thinking about it. The diagram below is called a Venn diagram and it helps us to look at a comparison between two things.

Oh, I see. So, the information that is different about each person is listed as well as the information that is the same. It looks like the information that is the same about Washington and Lincoln is listed in the space where the circles overlap.
Right, so we can see that Washington was born in Virginia and Lincoln was born in Kentucky. However, they are both U.S. Presidents!
I get it. This comparison makes sense.

Question.text: _user_, this paragraph shows some differences between walking and running. Which highlighted sentence has the best comparison?

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: Look closely at the sentences to see which one includes a good comparison between walking and running.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: It seems like both the second and the third answers only mention either walking or running. That is not much of a comparison.

Answer.name: CristinaExplain
Answer.text: The second and third answer options contain separate information about walking and running, but do not directly compare them.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: Only the first answer option includes a comparison between walking and running. It tells us that running has a greater risk of injury. The other two sentences clarify why that is true.

Answer.name: RepeatCorrect
Answer.text: The first sentence has the best comparison.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which highlighted sentence has the best comparison?

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I think it is the first one. I see the key words difference between running and walking.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: Maybe it is the third one. It says that walking is less damaging to the joints.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: This one talks about running, not walking. So it is not a comparison.
Answer.speech: This one talks about running, not walking. So it is not a comparison.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: This one talks about walking, not running. So it is not a comparison.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: This one only talks about running, but it does not mention walking. So it is not a comparison.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: This sentence describes walking, but it does not mention running. So it is not a comparison.

Answer.name: JordanAdmitWrong
Answer.text: I see. The correct answer should include a comparison between the two in one sentence.

Question.text: _user_, what could a runner do on their own to avoid an injury?

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: Find the sentence that mentions how to reduce the risk of injury during running.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: The first sentence mentions reducing the risk of injury.

Answer.name: CristinaExplain
Answer.text: In order to get the right shoes, you may need to work with an expert.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The second and third answers both mention consulting an expert. A runner could find better surfaces on their own.

Answer.name: RepeatCorrect
Answer.text: The risk of injury is reduced if you run on a good surface.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, what could a runner do on their own to make sure an injury does not occur?

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: The first sentence seems correct. You can be smart about looking for the best surfaces on your own.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I think I choose the second one. Wearing good shoes may reduce the risk of injury. If I wear comfortable shoes, my feet will not hurt.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: It can be difficult to know about correct form and technique without the help of a professional.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: I see that this answer mentions talking to a shoe expert, because you may not know how to find the right kind of shoes on your own.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: You may need to consult a professional in order to understand the correct form and technique.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: You may require a shoe expert to explain the proper fit of your running shoes.

Answer.name: JordanAdmitWrong
Answer.text: Oh, I shouldn't guess based on my experience rather than from the passage!

Question.text: _user_, Mr. Johnson only has an hour to work out every day and he wants to burn more calories. which highlighted sentence could help him choose the best exercise to help him lose weight?

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: To answer this, we need to find the sentence that describes the difference between running and walking in terms of calorie consumption.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: You mean burning calories? We need to choose the exercise that burns the most calories in an hour.

Answer.name: CristinaExplain
Answer.text: We need to find a sentence that compares walking to running and tells us which burns more calories in the same amount of time.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: In the third answer option, you will find that running burns more calories per hour. Mr. Johnson should choose running.

Answer.name: RepeatCorrect
Answer.text: Running burns more calories!

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which highlighted sentence could help him choose between running and walking?

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I will choose the third answer, because it specifically compares running to walking on a calories burned per hour basis.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I think it is the first answer option, because when he walks, he can socialize with his friends. This saves him time, and also burns calories.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: I see that this sentence mentions walking is a good beginner exercise, but it does not mention that walking burns more calories.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: I feel like this is a similarity between walking and running. Mr. Johnson needs to choose one, so he needs to see a difference between the two.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: Notice that this sentence mentions walking is a good beginner exercise, but it does not mention that walking burns more calories than running.

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: Please see that this is a similarity between walking and running. Mr. Johnson needs to choose one, so he needs to see a difference between the two.

Question.text: _user_, which answer does NOT support the idea that walkers could achieve the same weight loss goals as runners?

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: Walkers need to burn more calories. So what could walkers do?

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: It looks to me like the second and third sentences give you information about how to burn more calories while walking.

Answer.name: CristinaExplain
Answer.text: If you look at the second and third sentences, you will see that the both give you information about how to burn more calories while walking.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The first sentence encourages you to walk if you like it better, but it does not tell you how to achieve your weight loss goals while walking as compared to running.

Answer.name: RepeatCorrect
Answer.text: Walking for a longer period of time will help you achieve a higher number of calories burned.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which of the following sentences does NOT list a way in which walkers could achieve the same weight loss goal as runners?

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I think it is the first sentence, because that one doesn't have any information about walking versus running.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: Maybe, the second one. I am not sure.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: It looks like this sentence is telling us you can walk farther in distance.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: I see that this one gives us two suggestions, walking more or eating less.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: Here it tells us that a walker can make up the difference with distance.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: In this answer, the passage gives us two ways in which we could achieve the same weight loss goals as runners.

Question.text: _user_, which sentence compares running and walking in terms of stress on the body?

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: Jordans sister is overweight, so we need to find some information on what exercise will cause the least amount of stress to her body.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: I think sentences one and two do not say much about exercise being stressful.

Answer.name: CristinaExplain
Answer.text: So, find the sentence that tells you what to do if you are overweight and see what is less stressful, walking or running?

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The third sentence says that walking is less stressful on the body - especially if you are overweight.

Answer.name: RepeatCorrect
Answer.text: Walking is less stressful on the body.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which sentence can help us decide what is best for Jordans sister?

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: According to sentence three, walking is less stressful.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: From reading the second sentence, I think she could walk or run. People can obtain the same health and fitness benefits by both running and walking.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: I don't think it is this one. This just says you can get more benefit from running in a shorter amount of time.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: I don't think this sentence says anything about what exercise is easier on the body.

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: This sentence evaluates running and walking based on the amount of time you have and not on the amount of stress on the body.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: Both walking and running can improve health. But for this question, you need to consider which one causes less stress on the body.

Question.text: _user_, which of the highlighted sentences shows another thing that walking and running have in common?

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: Look for a sentence that has a signal word for a similarity.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: The second sentence says running is more rigorous than walking and the third one says walking is a better exercise for beginners. I think both of those are differences.

Answer.name: CristinaExplain
Answer.text: If you look closely, the second sentence says running is more rigorous than walking whereas the third one says walking is a better exercise for beginners. These are examples of differences.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The first sentence shows a similarity between running and walking. Both are social activities.

Answer.name: RepeatCorrect
Answer.text: Both are social activities!

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which of the highlighted sentences shows walking and running have similarities?

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I am pretty sure it is the first sentence because it uses the word both.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I will choose the third one. Both are good exercises.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: I think this is actually a difference between walking and running.

Answer.name: JordanHintB
Answer.text: I guess this is a difference between walking and running.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: This sentence describes one of the differences between walking and running. Walking is better for beginners.

Answer.name: TAHintB
Answer.text: This sentence describes one of the differences between walking and running. Running is more effective in a short amount of time.

Question.text: _user_, which comparison is not mentioned in the text map?

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: Look at each answer and see if it matches with a piece of information in the chart.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: I see that the chart mentions injuries. It also says something about calories burned.

Answer.name: CristinaExplain
Answer.text: Tthe chart compares the level of risk of injury. It also compares calories burned.

Answer.text: The price of running shoes is not one of the comparisons from the passage.

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer

Answer.text: _user_. Let's look at the chart. Does it list anything about which one causes more injuries? We need to find the one not mentioned.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: Please look at the chart. Does it list anything about calories burned? You need to find the one not mentioned.

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: Please look at the chart. Does it list anything about which one causes more injuries? You need to find the one not mentioned.

Question.text: _user_, which sentence is correct according to the text map?

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: The chart provides a brief summary of our passage. It shows similarities and differences between walking and running.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: It seems like you can see the things they have in common in the middle of the chart.

Answer.name: CristinaExplain
Answer.text: Based on the chart, running can help reduce more weight than walking. So the second one is not correct.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The chart doesn't compare diet with walking and running. So the third one is incorrect. The correct statement is the first one. You can see these benefits listed in the middle of the two circles.

Answer.name: RepeatCorrect
Answer.text: The first statement is correct!

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, which statement is correct according to the chart?

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer

Answer.text: A good summary should contain the main idea of the passage.

Answer.text: So this one is a bad summary. The first one is a good summary, because it contains the main idea and an example.

Question.text: _user_, what should be included in a summary of a comparison text?

Answer.name: ExplanationCristina
Answer.text: When you are comparing and contrasting information in a text, it is important to look at both the similarities and the differences between two or more things.

Answer.name: JordanExplain
Answer.text: I would have thought that only the differences matter.

Answer.name: CristinaExplain
Answer.text: In order to get all the facts, both similarities and differences can be important to find.

Answer.name: CorrectCristina
Answer.text: The best summaries include all the most important information. It can depend on what you want to know from the comparison, but usually you will need both the similarities and the differences.

Answer.name: RepeatCorrect
Answer.text: Both similarities and differences.

Answer.name: RepeatQuestion
Answer.text: _user_, what should be included in a summary of a comparison text?

Answer.name: JordanCorAnswer
Answer.text: I'm not sure. It seems like we would need both to make a good summary.

Answer.name: JordanIncorAnswer
Answer.text: I think this passage mostly stresses the differences, so I think you just need the differences.

Answer.name: JordanHintA
Answer.text: If the passage emphasizes both, I think both similarities and differences should be equally talked about. I don't think we should limit a summary to similarities.

Answer.name: JordanHintC
Answer.text: If the passage emphasizes both, I think both similarities and differences should be equally talked about. I don't think we should limit a summary to differences,

Answer.name: TAHintA
Answer.text: In a summary, you want to include all of the important information.

Answer.name: TAHintC
Answer.text: _user_ and ComputerStudent1 , you do not want to limit a summary to just the differences in the comparison.
